0.24.text:
If you're watching this then you've
arrived in our green and pleasant land,

3.82.text:
the land I called home, indeed welcome
to the house in which I grew up

7.83.text: I encourage you all to buy castles while you are here, they are cheap as chips and

13.45.text:
please enjoy your time here in God's
chosen landscape, Croeso i Gymru

17.68.text:
No, I didn't just cough, it means welcome to
Wales. We mean that sincerely.

28.40.text: Let me welcome you to Wales, you might be wondering what a man with my accent

33.08.text: is doing welcoming you to Wales. I am a

37.26.text: London Welshman and there are many of us

41.34.text:
and I'm very proud to be so, I am half
English

48.51.text:
always had a farmhouse in West Wales and
it is

52.24.text: I have to say my favorite place on Earth.

60.62.text: Croeso i Gymru. Welcome to Wales and

64.29.text:
Wales' Millennium Centre, home to the
Welsh National Opera

68.62.text:
and from time to time my home away from
home

71.70.text:
I'm really proud to be born Welsh, to
perform in Wales

75.91.text: and to live in Wales, call Wales my home.

79.65.text:
Welcome to Wales, Mr President. Few
Americans may have visited Wales

85.67.text: but of course you'll have heard of us, as nine of your presidents boast

89.75.text:
Welsh descent, the most famous perhaps
being Abraham Lincoln

93.50.text:
on whose Washington Memorial the words
inscribed

97.46.text: in Welsh, my country, my language

104.02.text: Although recently I read your mother's maiden name was Davies, so perhaps

107.92.text: you'll boast a 10th President from Wales?

115.83.text:
I suppose the cliche about Wales is that
it's a land of dragons,

123.70.text:
But when you're there, those things are
palpable. The magic, the mystical quality

129.77.text:
is very tangible and it does make it a
magical place

136.81.text: The gorgeous, natural, outstanding beaches that we have here,

139.92.text: places like Three Cliffs Bay and Worm's Head

143.21.text:
are just absolutely breathtaking and I would
tell you, you must go and visit them.

150.70.text:
What's better than a backdrop of a
mountain

153.99.text: or a castle, then you can walk up the street here

157.75.text:
to the Millennium Stadium, watch the
rugby, sometimes

168.95.text:
In my opinion Wales is a hidden gem of
the United Kingdom

173.08.text:
providing wonderful culture and music
and also has given the globe a couple a

179.45.text:
who are very pleased still to call this
place, this beautiful place, home.

183.67.text:
To be born in Wales is not to be
born with a silver spoon in your mouth

188.61.text: but with poetry in your soul,

193.90.text: God's country as my grandfather would say.

198.44.text:
Welcome to Wales, we hope
you find it as magical as we do.

201.65.text: Croeso i Gymru. Welcome to Wales

204.77.text: Croeso i Gymru. Welcome to Wales

207.30.text: We hope you enjoy your visit to Wales.

209.76.text:
One thing I'm sure you are wondering is
why you didn't come here sooner

212.70.text: and one thing is for certain, there will always be a welcome.
